alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Dillon; Florence; Marion; Marlboro (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 6:44PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Florence, southwestern Dillon, southeastern Darlington, northwestern Marion and south central Marlboro Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 644 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Timmonsville, or near Florence, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Florence, Dillon, Latta, Quinby, Sellers, Blue Brick, Mars Bluff, Effingham, Brownsville, Oak Grove, Florence Darlington Technical College Main Campus, Francis Marion University, Bingham, Floydale, Claussen, Carolinas Hospital System, Mcleod Regional Medical Center, Mcleod Medical Center, Carolinas Hospital System - Cedar Tower and Health South Rehabilitation Hospital. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 between mile markers 134 and 141. Interstate 95 in South Carolina between mile markers 155 and 193. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northeastern South Carolina. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northeastern South Carolina.
